verses.text: But thou shalt remember the Lord thy God: for it is he that giveth thee power to get wealth...
verses.paraphrase: God's the one who gave you the skills to get that bag. Stay humble. ğŸ’»â¡ï¸ğŸ’°

verses.text: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
verses.paraphrase: Ship quality code consistently, and you'll be in the big leagues. No more legacy code maintenance. ğŸ˜

verses.text: This book of the law shall not depart out of thy mouth; but thou shalt meditate therein day and night... for then thou shalt make thy way prosperous, and then thou shalt have good success.
verses.paraphrase: Keep the docs and best practices top of mind, day and night. That's the real path to a successful deploy. ğŸš€

verses.text: Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour. For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falleth...
verses.paraphrase: Pair programming > solo coding. Who else will catch your off-by-one error before prod? ğŸ‘¯â€â™‚ï¸

verses.text: For the body is not one member, but many... If the whole body were an eye, where were the hearing?
verses.paraphrase: The team needs frontend, backend, QA, and DevOps. You can't all be the JavaScript framework of the week. ğŸ§±ğŸ‘‚ğŸ¦µ

verses.text: Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
verses.paraphrase: A good PR review sharpens the code and the coder. No blunt edges allowed. âš”ï¸

verses.text: And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
verses.paraphrase: Don't stop shipping good code. The feature launch is coming, just don't rage-quit first. ğŸŒ±â¡ï¸ğŸ

verses.text: But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.
verses.paraphrase: Take a break, touch grass, and your strength will be renewed. You'll come back and crush that sprint. ğŸ¦…

verses.text: Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
verses.paraphrase: Jesus' API is always available. POST /rest for those heavy-laden with tech debt. ğŸ›Œ

verses.text: Let us run with patience the race that is set before us...
verses.paraphrase: It's a marathon, not a sprint. Even when the product roadmap changes... again. ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸ğŸ’¨

verses.text: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life...
verses.paraphrase: Blessed is the dev who endures the temptation to push straight to main. They will receive the crown of a clean git history. ğŸ‘‘

verses.text: Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ.
verses.paraphrase: God started a good work in your codebase, and He's gonna see it through to v1.0. Keep refactoring. ğŸ”§

verses.text: But grow in grace, and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ...
verses.paraphrase: Never stop learning. Your knowledge graph should have more nodes than your production database. ğŸ§

verses.text: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels.
verses.paraphrase: A senior dev listens to feedback and keeps learning. Stay humble, stay hungry. ğŸ½ï¸

verses.text: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
verses.paraphrase: I can learn Rust, debug distributed systems, and survive a planning meeting. Through Christ who strengthens my Google-fu. ğŸ’ª

verses.text: Through faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God, so that things which were seen were not made of things which do appear.
verses.paraphrase: The universe was framed by a command. You build your app from void main(). Speak it into existence. âœ¨

verses.text: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth. And the earth was without form, and void...
verses.paraphrase: God started with an empty repo. Your README.md is 'Let there be light'. Now start committing. ğŸŒŒ

verses.text: And I have filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship... to work in all manner of work.
verses.paraphrase: God fills devs with wisdom and skill for all kinds of craftsmanship: UI, algorithms, you name it. Your talent is a gift. ğŸ› ï¸

verses.text: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
verses.paraphrase: Code it by faith, not by sight. You haven't seen it work yet, but you hope for that 'Hello, World!' âœ¨

verses.text: Trust in the Lord with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding. In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
verses.paraphrase: Don't lean on your own understanding of the legacy codebase. Acknowledge God, and He will guide your debugger. ğŸ§­

verses.text: Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God. And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.
verses.paraphrase: Don't panic about the production outage. Pray about it. God's peace will guard your heart and mind while you ssh into the server. ğŸ•Šï¸

verses.category: â¤ï¸ Love for the Craft / Passion for Building
verses.text: And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
verses.paraphrase: Write your code heartily, as if God is the Senior Dev reviewing your PR. Not for the PM. ğŸ™

verses.category: â¤ï¸ Love for the Craft / Passion for Building
verses.text: Delight thyself also in the Lord: and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
verses.paraphrase: When your delight is in the Creator, He'll give you a passion for creating. Now go build that side project. ğŸš€

verses.category: â¤ï¸ Love for the Craft / Passion for Building
verses.text: Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion...
verses.paraphrase: There's nothing better than a dev who enjoys their own work. That feeling after a clean deploy? That's your reward. ğŸ˜Œ

verses.text: The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.
verses.paraphrase: God is your firewall, VPN, and 2FA all in one. No unauthorized access to your peace. ğŸ”

verses.text: But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.
verses.paraphrase: God's CI/CD pipeline never fails. He'll establish your code and protect it from evil bugs. ğŸ›¡ï¸

verses.text: But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.
verses.paraphrase: Optimize your code and it will run like eagles, not crash like IE6. ğŸ¦…

verses.text: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
verses.paraphrase: Your app can handle all the traffic through Christ who strengthens your load balancer. âš¡

verses.text: Call unto me, and I will answer thee, and show thee great and mighty things, which thou knowest not.
verses.paraphrase: Stack Overflow is good, but prayer shows you solutions you never knew existed. ğŸ”

verses.text: If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
verses.paraphrase: Stuck on a bug? God gives wisdom liberally - no Stack Overflow points required. ğŸ§

verses.text: The Lord gave the word: great was the company of those that published it.
verses.paraphrase: God gives the feature, we just deploy it. Great is the team that ships to production! ğŸš€

verses.text: And let the beauty of the Lord our God be upon us: and establish thou the work of our hands upon us; yea, the work of our hands establish thou it.
verses.paraphrase: Let the beauty of clean code be upon us, and establish our deployment so it doesn't rollback. âœ¨

verses.text: Behold, I make all things new.
verses.paraphrase: God's the original maintainer. Every commit with Him is a major version upgrade. ğŸ”„

verses.text: Therefore if any man be in Christ, he is a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.
verses.paraphrase: In Christ, you're v2.0. All legacy code is deprecated. Time to refactor your life. â™»ï¸

verses.text: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.
verses.paraphrase: A wise dev's heart teaches their IDE, adding clean code to their commits. ğŸ“Š

verses.text: For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.
verses.paraphrase: Wisdom > Big Data. All the machine learning models can't compare to divine insight. ğŸ’

verses.text: That they all may be one; as thou, Father, art in me, and I in thee, that they also may be one in us: that the world may believe that thou hast sent me.
verses.paraphrase: The ultimate distributed system - all nodes connected to the main server. Perfect uptime. ğŸŒ

verses.text: Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour.
verses.paraphrase: Pair programming > solo coding. Better merge requests, fewer conflicts. ğŸ‘¥

verses.text: And he gave some, apostles; and some, prophets; and some, evangelists; and some, pastors and teachers;
verses.paraphrase: God's org chart: Architects, Senior Devs, Tech Evangelists, and Code Reviewers. Everyone has a role. ğŸ“ˆ

verses.text: Without counsel purposes are disappointed: but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.
verses.paraphrase: No code review = failed deployment. Many reviewers = production ready. âœ…

verses.text: The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.
verses.paraphrase: Clean code and ethical practices guide you. Tech debt and shortcuts destroy your project. âš–ï¸

verses.text: Provide things honest in the sight of all men.
verses.paraphrase: Write honest code that passes code review. No hidden vulnerabilities. ğŸ”

verses.text: But this one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind, and reaching forth unto those things which are before,
verses.paraphrase: One task at a time. Forget the broken build, focus on the next feature. ğŸ¯

verses.text: Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in the grave, whither thou goest.
verses.paraphrase: Code with all your might - no debugging in the afterlife. Make this commit count! ğŸ’ª

verses.text: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither shadow of turning.
verses.paraphrase: VS Code, GitHub, React - every good dev tool is a gift from above. No runtime errors with God. ğŸ› ï¸

verses.text: I have planted, Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.
verses.paraphrase: You write the code, the team reviews it, but God makes it scale. ğŸŒ±

verses.text: And on the seventh day God ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.
verses.paraphrase: Even God took a break after shipping creation. Your side project can wait until Monday. ğŸ˜´

verses.text: It is vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, to eat the bread of sorrows: for so he giveth his beloved sleep.
verses.paraphrase: Stop burning midnight oil debugging. God gives His beloved devs sleep and fresh perspectives. ğŸ’¤
